Package ohos.account.app

Class AppAccountAbility

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.account.app.AppAccountAbility

  • public class AppAccountAbility
extends Object
    Provides methods for managing application accounts.

    For example, you can use these methods to add or delete an application account, update account information, authorize access to an application account, and subscribe to or unsubscribe from account changes.

    Since:
    4
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Account#APP_ACCOUNT

    • Method Detail

      • getAllAccounts

        public List<AppAccount> getAllAccounts​(String owner)
        Obtains information about all accounts of a specified account owner.

        This method applies to the following accounts:

        • Accounts of this application.
        • Accounts of third-party applications. To obtain such information, your application must have gained authorization from the third-party applications or have gained the ohos.permission.GET_ACCOUNTS_PRIVILEGED permission.
        Parameters:
        owner - Indicates the account owner of your application or third-party applications.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of application accounts.
        Since:
        4

      • subscribeAccountEvent

        public boolean subscribeAccountEvent​(IAppAccountSubscriber subscriber,
                                     List<String> owners)
        Subscribes to the change events of accounts of the specified owners.

        When the account owner updates the account, the subscriber will receive a notification about the account change event.

        Parameters:
        subscriber - Indicates the subscriber, which is specified by IAppAccountSubscriber.
        owners - Indicates the account owners, which are specified by AppAccount#AppAccount(String name, String owner).
        Returns:
        Returns true if the subscription is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • unsubscribeAccountEvent

        public boolean unsubscribeAccountEvent​(IAppAccountSubscriber subscriber)
        Unsubscribes from account events.
        Parameters:
        subscriber - Indicates the subscriber, which is specified by IAppAccountSubscriber.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the unsubscription is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • addAccount

        public boolean addAccount​(String name,
                          String extraInfo)
        Adds the account name and extra information of this application to the account management service.

        Only the owner of the application account has the permission to call this method.

        Parameters:
        name - Indicates the name of the application account to add.
        extraInfo - Indicates the extra information of the application account to add. The extra information cannot be sensitive information of the application account.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • deleteAccount

        public boolean deleteAccount​(String name)
        Deletes an application account from the account management service.

        Only the owner of the application account has the permission to call this method.

        Parameters:
        name - Indicates the name of the application account to delete.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • getAllAccessibleAccounts

        public List<AppAccount> getAllAccessibleAccounts​()
        Obtains information about all accessible accounts.

        This method applies to the following accounts:

        • Accounts of this application.
        • Accounts of third-party applications. To obtain such information, your application must have gained authorization from the third-party applications.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of application accounts.
        Since:
        4

      • enableAppAccess

        public boolean enableAppAccess​(String name,
                               String bundleName)
        Enables a third-party application with the specified bundle name to access the given application account for data query and listening.
        Parameters:
        name - Indicates the name of the application account.
        bundleName - Indicates the bundle name of the third-party application.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the third-party application is enabled to access the given application account; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • disableAppAccess

        public boolean disableAppAccess​(String name,
                                String bundleName)
        Disables a third-party application with the specified bundle name from accessing the given application account.
        Parameters:
        name - Indicates the name of the application account to disable access from the third-party application.
        bundleName - Indicates the bundle name of the third-party application.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the third-party application is disabled from accessing the given application account; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • setAccountExtraInfo

        public boolean setAccountExtraInfo​(String name,
                                   String extraInfo)
        Sets extra information for this application account.

        You can call this method when you forget the extra information of your application account or need to modify the extra information.

        Parameters:
        name - Indicates the name of the application account.
        extraInfo - Indicates the extra information to set.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • getAccountExtraInfo

        public String getAccountExtraInfo​(String name)
        Obtains extra information of this application account.
        Parameters:
        name - Indicates the name of the application account.
        Returns:
        Returns the extra information of the account; returns null in other scenarios, for example, if the account does not exist.
        Since:
        4

                                 String key,

        key - Indicates the key of the data to set. The key can be customized.

        key - Indicates the key of the data to obtain.
        Returns:

        Since:

      • setAppAccountSync

        public boolean setAppAccountSync​(String name,
                                 boolean isEnable)
        Sets whether a specified application account allows application data synchronization.

        If the same HarmonyOS account has logged in to multiple devices, these devices constitute a super device through the distributed networking. On the networked devices, you can call this method to set whether to allow cross-device data synchronization. If synchronization is allowed, application data can be synchronized among these devices in the event of any changes related to the application account. If synchronization is not allowed, the application data is stored only on the local device.

        Application account-related changes: adding or deleting an application account, setting extra information (such as updating a token), and setting data associated with this application account

        Application data that can be synchronized: application account name, token, and data associated with this application account

        Permissions: SystemPermission.DISTRIBUTED_DATASYNC

        Parameters:
        name - Indicates the name of the application account.
        isEnable - Specifies whether to allow application data synchronization.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        5

      • getAppAccountSync

        public boolean getAppAccountSync​(String name)
        Checks whether a specified application account allows application data synchronization.

        If the same HarmonyOS account has logged in to multiple devices, these devices constitute a super device through the distributed networking. On the networked devices, you can call this method to check whether application data can be synchronized.

        Permissions: SystemPermission.DISTRIBUTED_DATASYNC

        Parameters:
        name - Indicates the name of the application account.
        Returns:
        Returns true if application data synchronization is allowed; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        5
        See Also:
        setAppAccountSync(java.lang.String, boolean)
